What documents do I typically need for a job application in Germany?

A German job application usually includes a CV, leaving certificates from school/university, internship certificates (copies only), and optionally an application photo. Always check the job announcement for specific requirements.

Should I include a photo in my German job application?
While not mandatory, application photos are customary. Use a professional, neutral portrait photo (head, neck, upper body) placed at the top right of your CV or cover sheet. Avoid casual pictures.

How should I format my CV for German employers?

German CVs are structured as tables with categories like personal data, education, and skills. Keep it concise—omit irrelevant details (e.g., vacations). Refer to Europass (https://europa.eu/europass/en) for guidance.

Do international students with German degrees have equal job opportunities?
Yes, foreign graduates with German degrees generally have the same job chances as German applicants. Networking during studies (e.g., projects, university groups) can boost opportunities.
